column4: i run windows vista and i've set up a ubuntu server. i would like to connect to it remotely. should i use VNC or RDP and i've also heard about freeNX
whats fastest, what will work under vista, could i use remote desktop with all of these ?
rdesktop if you enable remote logon
vnc is very heavy and unencrypted
what is rdesktop? is it rdp? is it faster than the others?
it just integrates better as its made by microsoft for their OS
i think it comes default with ubuntu installation and i've already used it, but its slow
it also uses 128bit encryption so is quite secure wheras vnc isnot
no the default is vnc and yes it is slow
why do you need to see a full desktop though? Can you not get web interfaces to your apps?
you will have to enable remote login enabled
rdp will also lock the local system's display as you only have a single desktop licence on the system
no problem if the local system will become locked. as long as its a fast and secure way, its good
i'd look into more sophistcated ways to interface with the system. oftem the whole desktop is not needed
e.g. vlc has a web interface which can be used instead of streaming the entire screen to manage audio playback
i use a software called "PersonalBrain" and i want to use it from a remote machine, thats why i need the desktop
